intro: Roupala obtusata, commonly known as the broad-leaved roupala, is a deciduous shrub native to the temperate regions of South America. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, rounded growth habit and showy, clustered white flowers. The leaves are broad, ovate, and often have a waxy texture, which helps reduce water loss in its native environment. The plant produces small, woody fruits that contain several seeds, aiding in its propagation. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and floral display.
